name: Pestana Carlton Madeira

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Pestana Carlton during the last week in August. From our experience at the hotel we can only agree with other readers when they say the hotel does not deliver 5* service. The facilities themselves are good, the room we had was on the 14th floor overlooking the mountains, was of a good size, well decorated and very clean. The bathroom was also in good order and very clean. We did not have any problems with noise from the air conditioning as a previous reader had but we did get woken up three times in the week at approx 3am from revellers turning out of the clubs nearby and making their way home!!
reviews.title: Definitely Not 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problems we had with the room were that the tea and coffee cups and dirty glasses were not replaced for three days and then only when we asked room service to sort it out for us. We had taken our own teabags with us from reading other reviews about the charges for teabags and coffee. The turn down service is hit and miss and we did not receive turn down until the 4th night of our stay.
reviews.title: great hotel, but not 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was poor compared with other 5* hotels we have stayed in. The fresh fruit section was very limited and if you want boiled eggs be sure to ask for them to be cooked for you else they are very underdone and the yolks were almost raw!! The other hot food is self service but a chef will cook omlettes to order, but we did not try any. They ran out of very low fat yogurts after the third day and were not replaced for the rest of the week. The sparkling wine is hidden away in the alcove opposite the desk on entry to the restaurant, where the morning news sheets are displayed. Hot water, instant coffee and tea bags were only put out on the first morning (Sat) and then you had to ask for tea or coffee from the waiter
reviews.title: Nice - but 5 star ?!?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terrace area for breakfast is very nice but if you are an ardent non smoker like myself it was a nightmare as people light up on the table next to you with no regard for anyone else trying to enjoy their food. The restaurant does not have a smoking section outside to try to seperate the non smokers and smokers. After the first two days we sat inside to avoid having to smoke other peoples cigarettes. If you want an outside smoke free table be sure to be down for breakfast early i.e. 07:30am and you may achieve this.
reviews.title: super hotel

likes.disliked: — The cost of the items in the fridge in the room.

reviews.text: If you order lunch from the pool bar do not expect it to arrive warm even if you order hot food. We found the staff at the pool bar to be very stern, at times almost rude and did not understand the concept of 5* service at all. They were happy to stand talking and let the food go cold on the kitchen bar. One day we had to ask them to get our food as we could see it was waiting to be served but they were too busy talking.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have arrived on the 6th December and left on the 8th. 2 excellent nights at Pestana Carlton and 3 wonderful days at Madeira.
reviews.title: Excelent Pestana Carlton

likes.liked: — The rooms quality and the excellent breakfast served
likes.disliked: — The prices at the Bar and Restaurant were a little expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very well sized, cleaned and had a modern furniture. All the employees were extremely nice and yet, very professional.
reviews.title: Overrated timeshare business - not a 5* hotel (not for service anyway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were amazing. The outdoor pool, even on December was really inviting for a bath. The Hotel has also a pool nearby the sea with salted water, and for the ones who like a little privacy there was an indoor pool, with the water at an excellent 28ºC.
reviews.title: Our Second Home

likes.liked: — Made so welcome from the moment you arrive
likes.disliked: — When it rains. But the island needs rain for the flowers and crops. atleast it is hot rain.

reviews.title: Best Time share so far
reviews.text: The only thing i would change, is the Hotel's Bar and Restaurant prices. A little expensive, but yet, there are plenty Restaurants and Bar's nearby :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ohhh, i almost forget. The breakfast. Simply incredible.
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.disliked: — Poor choice of english language tv programs

reviews.text: Stayed here for week at the beginning of September. The hotel occupies an excellent location, about 15 mins walk (mainly uphill) from the centre of Funchal. The hotel also has direct access to the sea via a lift down to the lower of the two outdoor swimming pools (Atlantic Pool), and there is a PADI dive centre on site. The Garden Pool has the nicer setting of the two outdoor pools and the pool bar/restaurant area looks to have been recently refurbished. The rooms are nicely furnished and generally we found the service to be good. My wife used the spa and thought the treatments were quite good.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: There are however a number of points which I feel let the hotel down somewhat. Parts of the hotel looked a little shabby and tired - particularly the gym area and around the Atlantic pool. The tennis courts were also out of action for the duration (reading other reviews it looks like this has been the case for a while). I also thought that charging guests €2 per day for a parasol was a bit tight - especially for a 5 star hotel (I have never had this in any other 5 stars I have stayed in). I would also say that some of the food prices charged by the hotel are pretty expensive (even by 5 star standards), particularly when compared to the restaurants just outside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I come back to Madeira I would probably opt to stay at the Choupana Hills, Reid's or the Cliff Bay Hotel
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We spent in Pestana Carlton about two weeks in June. Our booked ocean view room turned to be a large and comfortable suite on the 12th floor. We travelled with friends who had cozy mountain view room on the 16th floor and night lights of Funchal were also very attractive.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Our 6 year old children loved both pools. When the ocean was still our daughter preferred snorkelling as the the hotel has direct access to the ocean.
reviews.title: Over rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The seaview room we had booked was spacious and kept very clean by friendly staff who always greeted you in passing. The bathroom had underfloor heating - lovely. We were B and B and having stayed in the same area before were familiar with nearby restaurants but on our first night decided to tryn the buffet dinner -- mistake ! For a very ordinary choice and quality for two plus one glass of wine I was charged 72.50 euros.Needless to we ate out for the rest of the week. Breakfast on the other hand was excellent from juices to bacon and eggs. Speaking to guests on half board the meals just did not come up to scratch. The opinion of diners in restaurants many of whom were in 5 star hotels and who had visited Madeira a few times was go B and B and have lunch or dinner out. The cost of our dining out varied from 34 Euros to 50 Euros including drinks I recommend Moby Dicks past Reids and O Regionall in the Old town.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for accommodation and location

reviews.text: Great hotel, staff, food and room excellent. Just one thing you might want to be aware of is the local restaurants will charge you for bread and butter, they will put it in front of you and charge between 4 and 6 euros I think that is far to high. but on the whole the resort was great.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were hugely disapointed with this hotel, its a 5* with 2* mentality. The management and the customer service are dreadfull. I could list individual incidents but it would take too long, but as example; surly and unhelpful staff, poor quality food, excessive pricing, typically your room tea & coffee is free for one day, thereafter 6 euros per refill !!
reviews.title: Should be the best but it's not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located at a hotel area just outside the city, about 10 minutes walk from “downtown”. Near the hotel there are a number of restaurants, so you don’t have to go downtown every time to eat. The Beach Boulevard starts at the Lido hotel area (abt 1 km from the hotel) and goes along the waterline away from the city – it is a nice walk if you feel like it. Overall the location is good, only thing we really missed was a larger supermarket, but those could be found downtown.
reviews.title: Perfect view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a junior suite and at first I was a bit afraid of what was to come, as we were assigned a room two floors below the reception (room 417). My fear was unnecessary as the room turned out to be perfect. It had a living area, nice bed and a huge balcony on two sides of the room with a perfect sea view (even from the bed). The room was clean and functional, with a flat screen tv, coffee/tea making facilities (beware of the cost) and a minibar. The prices of the minibar and the warm water bottles were steep so we bought our own.
reviews.title: very dissapointed

likes.liked: — the balcony had sun all day

description: This hotel was totally refurbished in 2008. Enjoying a prime sea-front location, Pestana Carlton Madeira is one of Funchal's best established hotels offering direct access to the sea and 5 minutes walking distance from the center. The hotel offers 4 swimming pools,2 out-door, 1 for children and 1 indoor, sauna, jacuzzi, gymnasium, scuba diving, minigolf, tennis court, games room, playground, 3 bars, 3 restaurants. All rooms feature air-conditioning, safe, coffee & tea facilities, minibar.
